page.title: 01Battisford Tye To Bird St.
page.content: The landscape consists of gently rolling large arable fields with clumps of trees and thorn hedges. The scattered farmhouses are mainly private homes where small farms have been absorbed into larger holdings. The main crop is winter wheat interspersed with oil seed rape, sugar beet and barley. The only livestock are intensively - kept pigs. Two fruit farms produce appless and pears. Most of the houses, including the Punch Bowl Inn and a thriving evengelical chapel, stand around a road junction at Battisford Tye wherre limited modern development has taken place among the old cottages. The majority of the younger residents work in local towns travelling daily by car and bus. The children are taken by bus to Stourmarket schools. The small attractive church stands in
